mapper.insert:
SELECT LAST_INSERT_ID()
insert into auth_rule (`type`, pid, `name`, title, icon, `condition`, remark, ismenu, createtime, updatetime, weigh, `status` ) values (#{type,jdbcType=CHAR}, #{pid,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{title,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{icon,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{condition,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{remark,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{ismenu,jdbcType=BIT}, #{createtime,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{updatetime,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{weigh,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{status,jdbcType=VARCHAR} )
mapper.update: update auth_rule set `type` = #{type,jdbcType=CHAR}, pid = #{pid,jdbcType=INTEGER}, `name` = #{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, title = #{title,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, icon = #{icon,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, `condition` = #{condition,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, remark = #{remark,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, ismenu = #{ismenu,jdbcType=BIT}, createtime = #{createtime,jdbcType=INTEGER}, updatetime = #{updatetime,jdbcType=INTEGER}, weigh = #{weigh,jdbcType=INTEGER}, `status` = #{status,jdbcType=VARCHAR} where id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}
mapper.select: select id, `type`, pid, `name`, title, icon, `condition`, remark, ismenu, createtime, updatetime, weigh, `status` from auth_rule where id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}
